intro: Petrorhagia lycica, commonly known as the Armenian rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Armenia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Petrorhagia lycica is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
